intro: Scabiosa transsylvanica, commonly known as the Transylvanian scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe, particularly found in regions such as Romania and the Czech Republic. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows in open woodland and grassy areas, preferring well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are upright and often branched. Scabiosa transsylvanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
